data.title: North Korean scientist flees to Finland with gigabytes of data on inhumane experiments with biochemical weapons, will testify before European parliament later this month

Top ISIS Leader Killed by US Drone Strike in Syria
Blasphemy decriminalised in Iceland. A bill submitted by the Pirate Party in aftermath of Charlie Hebdo attacks in Paris approved in Icelandic parliament today.

Quebec bill calls animals 'sentient beings' and includes jail time for cruelty: "Animals in Quebec will be considered "sentient beings" instead of property under a bill tabled in the national assembly Friday."
Up to 11,000 Australian dental patients were urged to see their doctors on Thursday over fears they may have been exposed to HIV and hepatitis due to hygiene breaches at clinics in Sydney.

China says retired officials can be punished for pollution. Even officials who have retired will be held accountable and punished for pollution which occurred under their watch, state media said on Wednesday after a government meeting chaired by President Xi Jinping.
Leaked TPP paper shows US pushing drug company rights
Myanmar fisherman goes home after 22 years as a slave
U.S. seeks FIFA officials' extradition from Switzerland - CNN.com
In WikiLeaks, Saudi money floods India to promote Wahhabism.
The ‘humanitarian aid’ aboard a recent flotilla to Gaza fit in two cardboard boxes.
Children who speak out in class against homosexuality could be viewed as potential extremists under Government guidelines intended to prevent Islamist terrorism, Nicky Morgan

Honduras' Supreme Court has ordered the arrest of the vice president of Congress and 15 other people accused of defrauding the country's health care system in a corruption scandal that has sparked large street protests.
